data.title: Work is the drug that keeps Boots billionaire on song

data.text:
If Stefano Pessina had stuck with his first career as a nuclear engineer in his native Italy, he would have retired six years ago. As it is, the 71-year-old billionaire has no intention of slowing down.

Even having enriched himself beyond most people’s dreams through a series of huge healthcare deals — the latest being the £10bn merger of Boots with America’s biggest pharmacy chain, Walgreens — Pessina works seven days a week. He shuns holidays and has no use for fast cars.

“Work is interesting and it keeps me busy,” he shrugs.
